EXTRACTED VALUE: Unfortunately, with such drab presentation and predictable gameplay, there isn't enough to sustain interest for long.
Even with all its problems, Frontlines is a game that can be still be fun to play if you give it a bit of time.
A huge, lazy and sometimes glitchy disappointment of a game.
A bit of a mixed bag. A half-decent tennis sim crocked by middle of the road graphics and an infuriatingly stupid and poorly implemented career mode.
This is great, but expect repetitive block smashing and item collecting that, in this third LEGO game, has overstayed its welcome.
Definitely the type of game to park your brain in neutral, play and enjoy without expecting too much from it.
Whoever designed the levels in this game, clearly didn't bring a lot of effort or imagination into it.
Mostly, this game is just another semi-realistic FPS.
